metadata.name: UAE Corporate Tax Law Extended Q&A Dataset
metadata.description: Extended synthetic Q&A pairs for comprehensive RAG evaluation with multi-hop questions, edge cases, and stress tests

questions.question: What is the standard corporate tax rate in the UAE?
questions.expected_answer: 9% on taxable income exceeding AED 375,000

questions.question: Who is exempt from corporate tax in the UAE?
questions.expected_answer: Government entities, government controlled entities, extractive businesses, non-extractive natural resource businesses, qualifying public benefit entities, qualifying investment funds, public pension funds, social security funds, and private pension funds

questions.question: When does the UAE Corporate Tax Law come into effect?
questions.expected_answer: Tax Periods commencing on or after 1 June 2023

questions.question: How is taxable income calculated under the UAE Corporate Tax Law?
questions.expected_answer: Taxable income is calculated based on accounting income prepared in accordance with accounting standards, subject to adjustments as specified in the law

questions.question: What is the arm's length principle for transfer pricing?
questions.expected_answer: Transactions between Related Parties must be conducted as if they were between independent parties dealing at arm's length

questions.question: What are the penalties for violations under the Corporate Tax Law?
questions.expected_answer: Administrative penalties as specified in the Tax Procedures Law, and the Authority may assess corporate tax where a person fails to comply

questions.question: What are the conditions for a Free Zone Person to benefit from 0% tax rate?
questions.expected_answer: Must be a Qualifying Free Zone Person, maintain adequate substance, derive Qualifying Income, and comply with transfer pricing rules

questions.question: What are the requirements for forming a Tax Group?
questions.expected_answer: Parent company must own at least 95% of share capital and voting rights, same financial year, prepared using same accounting standards, not exempt persons or Free Zone Persons

questions.question: How are tax losses carried forward?
questions.expected_answer: Tax Losses can be carried forward and set off against Taxable Income of subsequent Tax Periods, subject to limitations based on ownership changes

questions.question: What types of income are exempt from corporate tax?
questions.expected_answer: Dividends and other profit distributions from UAE companies, capital gains from sale of shares in qualifying conditions, income from qualifying restructuring transactions

questions.question: Who must register for corporate tax in the UAE?
questions.expected_answer: Every Taxable Person must register for Corporate Tax purposes with the Authority

questions.question: When must a tax return be filed?
questions.expected_answer: Within 9 months from the end of the relevant Tax Period

questions.question: What constitutes a Permanent Establishment?
questions.expected_answer: A fixed place of business through which the business is wholly or partly carried on, or a person who habitually exercises authority to conclude contracts

questions.question: How are Related Parties defined?
questions.expected_answer: Persons are related if one controls the other, or they are under common control, or through ownership of 50% or more

questions.question: What is the small business relief threshold?
questions.expected_answer: Revenue does not exceed AED 3,000,000 in the relevant Tax Period and all previous Tax Periods

questions.question: Is there a withholding tax on payments to non-residents?
questions.expected_answer: Withholding Tax at 0% applies to payments of UAE sourced income to non-residents

questions.question: What are the anti-abuse provisions in the law?
questions.expected_answer: General Anti-Abuse Rule allows the Authority to make adjustments where arrangements are entered into to obtain a Corporate Tax advantage that is inconsistent with the intention of the law

questions.question: What accounting standards must be used?
questions.expected_answer: Financial Statements must be prepared in accordance with IFRS or other accounting standards as may be accepted by the Authority

questions.question: What are the conditions for tax-neutral business restructurings?
questions.expected_answer: Transfer of assets or liabilities in exchange for shares, parties must be Taxable Persons, and must meet specific conditions including continuity of ownership

questions.question: What expenditures are deductible for corporate tax purposes?
questions.expected_answer: Expenditure incurred wholly and exclusively for business purposes, subject to specific limitations for entertainment, interest, and other specified items

questions.question: What is the interest deduction limitation rule?
questions.expected_answer: Net interest expenditure is limited to 30% of EBITDA, with excess carried forward for up to 10 years

questions.question: What is a Tax Period?
questions.expected_answer: The Gregorian calendar year or the 12-month period for which the Taxable Person prepares Financial Statements

questions.question: Can a taxpayer request clarification from the Authority?
questions.expected_answer: A Taxable Person may apply to the Authority for a clarification on the application of the provisions of this Decree-Law

questions.question: How is foreign tax credit calculated?
questions.expected_answer: Credit for foreign tax paid may be claimed against Corporate Tax payable, limited to the amount of Corporate Tax that would be payable on the foreign-sourced income

questions.question: When is a natural person subject to corporate tax?
questions.expected_answer: A natural person is subject to Corporate Tax if they conduct business or business activity in the UAE with turnover exceeding AED 1,000,000

questions.question: What is the corporate tax rate for income below and above AED 375,000?
questions.expected_answer: 0% on taxable income up to AED 375,000 and 9% on taxable income exceeding AED 375,000

questions.question: What happens if a Free Zone Person earns non-qualifying income?
questions.expected_answer: If a Qualifying Free Zone Person derives non-Qualifying Income, they may lose their qualifying status and become subject to the standard 9% Corporate Tax rate on all taxable income

questions.question: Can losses be transferred between Tax Group members?
questions.expected_answer: Yes, Tax Losses may be transferred between Tax Group members, subject to conditions including the same ownership requirements being met

questions.question: What documentation is required for related party transactions?
questions.expected_answer: Transactions with Related Parties must be documented with transfer pricing documentation demonstrating arm's length pricing, including master file and local file requirements for larger businesses

questions.question: How is the taxable income of a Permanent Establishment calculated?
questions.expected_answer: The taxable income attributable to a Permanent Establishment is determined based on the functions performed, assets used, and risks assumed, using arm's length principles

questions.question: What conditions must be met for dividends to be exempt?
questions.expected_answer: Dividends from UAE resident companies are generally exempt, while dividends from foreign companies may be exempt if ownership and holding period requirements are met

questions.question: Which expenses are not deductible for corporate tax purposes?
questions.expected_answer: Non-deductible expenses include bribes, fines, penalties, donations (except to approved entities), entertainment exceeding limits, and expenditure not for business purposes

questions.question: Can a Taxable Person use cash basis accounting?
questions.expected_answer: Small businesses meeting revenue thresholds may elect to use cash basis accounting, while larger businesses must use accrual accounting under IFRS

questions.question: What restrictions apply to loss carry forward after ownership changes?
questions.expected_answer: Tax Loss carry forward may be limited or restricted if there is a change in ownership of more than 50%, unless the same or similar business continues

questions.question: What types of business restructuring transactions qualify for tax relief?
questions.expected_answer: Qualifying restructuring transactions include mergers, spin-offs, transfers of business, and conversions, provided continuity of business and ownership conditions are met

questions.question: What is the process for tax registration?
questions.expected_answer: Taxable Persons must submit a registration application to the Authority within the specified timeframe, providing required information about the business and obtaining a Tax Registration Number

questions.question: What information must be included in a tax return?
questions.expected_answer: The tax return must include a calculation of Taxable Income, Corporate Tax payable, details of Related Party transactions, and any claims for reliefs or exemptions

questions.question: What are the consequences of tax evasion?
questions.expected_answer: Tax evasion may result in substantial administrative penalties, criminal prosecution, and payment of unpaid taxes plus interest

questions.question: How does withholding tax work for cross-border payments?
questions.expected_answer: UAE sourced income paid to non-residents is subject to withholding tax at 0%, but the payer must still comply with reporting requirements

questions.question: What is considered an abusive arrangement under the law?
questions.expected_answer: An arrangement is abusive if its main purpose or one of its main purposes is to obtain a Corporate Tax advantage that is not consistent with the intention of the law

questions.question: What limitations apply to foreign tax credits?
questions.expected_answer: Foreign tax credits are limited to the lesser of the foreign tax actually paid or the UAE Corporate Tax that would be payable on the foreign income

questions.question: What are the benefits of small business relief?
questions.expected_answer: Small business relief allows qualifying businesses to be treated as having no Taxable Income for the relevant Tax Period, effectively resulting in zero Corporate Tax

questions.question: What conditions must be met for a public benefit entity to be exempt?
questions.expected_answer: A public benefit entity must be established for charitable, religious, educational, or similar public benefit purposes, and its activities must not be conducted for profit

questions.question: How do interest limitation rules interact with Tax Groups?
questions.expected_answer: Interest limitation rules apply at the Tax Group level, with the 30% EBITDA limitation calculated on the consolidated basis of the Tax Group

questions.question: What methods can be used to determine arm's length prices?
questions.expected_answer: Acceptable methods include Comparable Uncontrolled Price method, Resale Price method, Cost Plus method, Transactional Net Margin method, and Transactional Profit Split method

questions.question: How are investment activities of natural persons taxed?
questions.expected_answer: Investment activities of natural persons, such as holding securities or real estate not conducted through a business, are generally not subject to Corporate Tax

questions.question: What is the binding effect of a clarification from the Authority?
questions.expected_answer: A clarification issued by the Authority is binding on the Authority in relation to the Taxable Person who requested it, provided the facts and circumstances have not changed

questions.question: Can a Taxable Person change their Tax Period?
questions.expected_answer: A Taxable Person may apply to the Authority to change their Tax Period, which may be approved if there is a valid business reason

questions.question: What are the requirements for qualifying investment funds?
questions.expected_answer: Qualifying investment funds must be regulated, have diverse ownership, and the investment manager must be independent and regulated

questions.question: How does the UAE corporate tax rate compare internationally?
questions.expected_answer: The UAE's 9% corporate tax rate is one of the lowest in the world, significantly below the global average of approximately 23%
